sentences: Lindude sulestik on must, aga tiibadel märkame valget laiku.
Mu riided said mustaks ja pidin neid pesema.
context: The Estonian word 'must' is a versatile adjective with multiple meanings depending on context. It primarily means 'black' as in color, but can also refer to darkness without light (dark nights), being dirty or unclean (clothes becoming dirty), grim/dreary moods, and even illegal or disgraceful activities. Its form changes based on grammatical case - as shown with 'must' (nominative singular), 'mustad' (nominative plural), and 'mustaks' (translative case).
